intro: Murucuia ocellata, commonly known as the spotted nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and distinctive spotted leaves. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in tropical regions. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
